p: There are many viruses associated with CNS infection. Table 4.1 summarizes the global distribution of viruses associated with CNS manifestations [ 1]. At least eight virus families have been associated with CNS infection, and these include different species from the deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA) virus families Herpesviridae and Polyomaviridae, as well as from the ribonucleic acid (RNA) virus families Flaviviridae, Paramyxoviridae, Picornaviridae, Retroviridae, Rhabdoviridae and Togaviridae [ 3]. Table 4.2 summarizes the classification of these most common viruses. In general it is accepted that HSV, VZV and enteroviruses, as a group, are responsible for most of the CNS infections in children [ 5].
